intro: Lastreopsis acuta, commonly known as the sharp-leaved lastreopsis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, fern-like leaves that are finely divided. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
